Posts.Content: dualgate wrote: Today is my last treatment of 33!!! I have an appointment thursday to see oncologist to get started on tamoxifen. Not sure how that is going to go, any advise from people out there on what to expect? could use any good tips. Thanks a lot to anyone responding!!! jamie Dx 11/11/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: finishing up radiation today!! dualgate paigelise

Posts.Content: dualgate wrote: Hi everyone, this is my first time on here, I sure hope It will help me.I am 45, I have stage 1 er&pr+ node negative BC. I hade a lumpectomy on Nov. 16th w/3 node removed. All surgery is healed up and Dr wants me to have chemo,(4 rounds) radiation and Tamoxifin. I am waiting on results of Oncotype DX test and have joined a clinical trial.Should get the results today or thursday.I have an appointment for a 2nd opinion at Iowa City hospital and clinic on the 30th. Oh and the tumor was 1.3 cm. What Id like to know is if anyone did the Oncotype DX test and how reliable of a tool is it? I have no problem doing chemo, I just want to make sure the risk is worth it to me. I've informed my oncologist that if I dont agree with the treatment in the study I will back out and they said that is fine, it's my decision, but I really want to help anyway I can to find a cure. I really need to know if the time frame is a problem? I was diagnosised on 11th, lumpectomy on nov.16th. and now Ill be waiting till after the new year to start treatment. Is the 2nd opinion something I should forgo so I can get started? I'm nervous about waiting longer. Please give any advise you can. Thank you so much. Dx 11/11/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: need some advise, Oncotype DX dualgate one-L

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2009 12:32PM dualgate wrote: Thanks so much to all of you. I feel so much better now and not so anxious about the time issue. I am so glad I found this site. yes that is the trail I've joined. But as I said before if the Dr. and I dont agree on the route to take for treatment I will be discontinuing the trial. But I will wait for the result and deal with it then. I am so glad to have other women who have been there to talk to!!! It just makes me feel more at ease. Thanks again!!!
Posts.Title: need some advise, Oncotype DX dualgate one-L

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2009 12:56PM dualgate wrote: This is so weird. As I was reading other posts I got the call about my onco test score. The post I was reading said they got a call from the dr. after they made their last post!!! Wow!! Oncotypre score came back at 13. I dont think that is to bad but the cut off for this study is 11, so Ill have to be radnomized and may end up with chemo, rad,and tamoxifin. Or just rad and tamoxifin. So good news? Hope so, now just relax and enjoy the holidays I guess! happy holidays to all of you!!!
Posts.Title: need some advise, Oncotype DX dualgate one-L

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 11:32AM dualgate wrote: I just finished up rads today and have appointment to see oncologist thursday for check and get started on Tamoxifen. Any ideas on how to deal with the drug? I've heard some stuff about it and want to clarify with people who have actually been throiugh it not just doctors and nurses. Jamie
